instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on..
definitions.PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC: What is PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC? PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing/charging chip. This can be shorted to ground by the capacitor on its line, and when this happens, the chip can stop functioning which causes the charger to not turn on. This can also be missing if the CD3215 chip itself is bad..
definitions.PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD: What is PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD? PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, no image
threads.message:
Good afternoon, this mac presented image only with the battery disconnected, I analyzed and identified oxidation in the region of UB300, <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and the track <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO</SIGNAL> that goes to RB310 was broken, I changed the UB300 and made track again, in the tests the mac does not present image and without activity in the USB, the CPU heats up a lot. 
    I tried another Bios that I found in the badcaps forum, but it didn't work.


Voltage: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 13.08v; <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.419V; <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.3v; <SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD</SIGNAL> 1.8v; <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> 0v;

Follows the BIOS backup.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1vqFsoQ-aG7MdMEdgU2WgYRbuxU77-lzT/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, no image
threads.message: So now you lost the image, even if battery is disconnected?
